note.p: Career: In business; Curator of the museum of the Bristol Philosophical Institution (1850); Lecturer in Botany, Bristol Medical School; Assistant Palaeontologist (1857), then Palaeontologist (1863), Geological Survey of Great Britain; Demonstrator upon Palaeontology, Royal School of Mines; Assistant Keeper of Geology, Natural History Museum (1881-1891); listed 18,000 British fossils
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1905 vol 75 pp 258-261signed by H B W
Notes: An early Year Book puts him as being a Vice-President 1874-1875, but this is incorrect - see CM 1884 and 1874.
